alert.note: Alert for Fergus; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:43PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Judith Basin and Fergus Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 243 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Lewistown, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Hobson, Winifred, Moore, Grass Range, Roy, Fergus, Forestgrove, Fred Robinson Bridge, Glengarry, Garneill, Danvers, Suffolk, Giltedge, Hilger, Heath, Christina and Buffalo. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 59 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 1 and 2, between mile markers 1 and 42, and between mile markers 27 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for central Montana.
